intro: Thesium szowitsii, commonly known as the New Zealand broom. This plant is a flowering species native to New Zealand, characterized by its erect, spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is typically found in coastal and lowland areas. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium szowitsii is adapted to sandy soils and is often seen growing in open, sunny habitats.
